lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: I understand you've been having chest pain. Tell me about that.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been getting pressure in my chest when I climb stairs or walk fast. It's been happening for about a week.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Is it sharp, dull, or more like pressure?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It's like a heaviness right in the center of my chest. Like someone is sitting on it.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Does the pain radiate anywhere?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: A couple of times I felt it going into my left arm.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How long does each episode last?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Usually about 5 to 10 minutes. It goes away when I stop and rest.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any shortness of breath, sweating, or nausea?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I get short of breath and sweaty when it happens. No nausea.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any history of heart disease or high cholesterol?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My cholesterol was around 240 last time. And my father had a heart attack at 55.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Are you taking any medications for cholesterol?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I stopped atorvastatin about six months ago because of muscle cramps.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Do you smoke or drink?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I don't smoke but I have a couple of beers most nights.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How old are you?

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: I want to run an EKG right now and order some blood work.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Whatever you think is best, doc.
